contentfulMotionPainting.title: Where I Belong
contentfulMotionPainting.subtitle: A celeberation of all things that are holy and have been living in a spiritual plain visible to humanity in different forms through the ages

description.raw:
{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Description","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"heading-2"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Human beings have had many mystical  and 
psychedelic encounters with higher levels of reality and the beings 
inhabiting them.These encounters have spawned several different divine 
beings and realms for human beings to hold sacred throughout the years.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"They
 have inspired  culture, mythology, religion, science, art and all other
 aspects of life in the most awe inspiring ways; without which imagining
 humanity as it stands today would be impossible.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Where I belong 
is a celebration of the different ideas people have had about the 
transcendent realms and it's inhabitants for inspiring humanity to push 
beyond their limits and lending it a helping hand from time to time. 
This piece took me a while to finish. In the following paragraphs I try 
to tell you the story of how it came to be.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Initial Concept And Making The Elements","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"heading-2"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"I
 have always been fascinated with esoteric and mystery schools of the 
ancient ages, ranging all the way back from Zoroastrian ideas and 
mythology to the vikings of the middle ages, there is wisdom to be found
 in each and one of these traditions. I had the idea of combining 
different symbolic higher entities from different traditions in one 
image, the initial idea was much more different as you can see by this 
initial sketch:","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"

Then I started designing the different elements on the screen. This part
 took the most amount of time because I am always adding or removing 
characters, buildings and everything that fits the vibe of the painting.
 First I draw every element's line art:

Some time after that the line art of the piece was done and I started 
coloring, which came up to a rough draft of the painting. I make sure in
 this stage that all the elements are in different layers and are 
ordered in the correct way to give the viewer a perception of the depth 
of the painting since I don't use any other method of discerning depth 
in the painting. Now that the static part is finished we move to the 
music.

Music","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"I have lived most of my life in Iran, and the great thing about it is 
that we have our own ethnic music, I used to play electric guitar since I
 finished high school but then I started gravitating to more Persian 
sounds, I discovered an ancient Persian instrument called the Tanbur 
and started studying it, after I was proficient enough I started to 
incorporate it in my ","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{"uri":"https://soundcloud.com/razmard"},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"music","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"hyperlink"},{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":".

I wanted to go for a vibe of grandeur and awe in this piece's music and 
what better way to utilize that than some good old phrygian dominant, I 
composed the track initially to be around 60 seconds, but after 
countless edits and listening I found the best timing for it would be 
around 30 seconds. Which came down to this:

After that I had to play and record the Tanbur on that and with some
 improvisation and luck, the result came out better than expected.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Animation","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"heading-2"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"This
 part is one of the most consuming aspects of the work, but it adds so 
much to the piece that I cannot think of skipping, it just "animates" 
the drawing you know? Pun intended.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"The process here is that each 
element is selected and pre-composed and animated according to some 
repeating loops so that the entire thing can loop at the end. After 
that's finished we have to go for a render.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"I
 had to render this one 6 times because of my computer's not so great 
processing power, I wasn't able to view the animation in real time and 
each time I found a minor thing that went wrong, after many tries I 
succeeded.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Then the piece gets encoded from a 14GB file down to the current size of around 19 MB. and we are done and it's ready to mint.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Due to the support of my amazing previous collectors and clients on ","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{"uri":"https://opensea.io/razmard?tab=created"},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"OpenSea","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"hyperlink"},{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"  I was able to mint on foundation this time which feels a little more professional.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"My Final Thoughts","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"heading-2"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"As
 a self learning artist I am grateful for the NFT space to give me a 
chance to make a living with the thing I love to do,I had a ","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{"uri":"https://razmard.com/about/"},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"rough journey","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"hyperlink"},{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"
 until I got to the point of deciding to do art full time but I never 
look back. It's an amazing journey and seeing my work become better and 
more refined by the passage of time I am grateful to be part of this 
amazing journey called life.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Terms","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"heading-2"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"By buying this NFT you agree that:","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"The artist can use the liking of the artwork in exhibitions, his own social media and online presence, etc.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"You
 can use the liking of the artwork in case of making derivatives, 
private prints (for your own use), and considering fair use in your own 
creative projects.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"You cannot resell the liking of the artwork.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"}],"nodeType":"unordered-list"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"



","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"document"}
